content.description: Start where possible on large, glaringly hollow, undercling system on far right side of boulder. Using whatever combination of underclings and feet that suit your bodytype, pull on and fire up and left for a positive edge.  Paste feet and top out on generous ledge\edges.
content.location: Furthest right problem on Alien boulder.

content.description: Sit start on arete\quartz on downhill\left side of the boulder. Work up and right on quartz knobs to vertical "pinch" and higher quartz flake to the left, topping out straight up.
content.location: Downhill left corner of the Alien Boulder, noteable for small overhanging feature.

content.description: Stand start left of tree, on obvious jug.  Work left-facing holds to the left and horizontal holds straight above to gain face, before making delicate moves straight up slab to top out.  Escaping to better holds to the right is possible but misses some of the fun.

Start at the obvious crack near the left end of the crag, a few feet right of the hickory tree. The crack itself has seen previous ascents, as has the face to the right.Alien starts in the crack, but then steps out left to climb the “alien head” to the top. A direct start may be possible, and other lines could exist closer to the tree.
content.protection: Large gear at top, or long anchors back to trees below. The hickory tree growing into the rock may prove useful as a directional anchor for climbs immediately adjacent to it.
content.location: Start at obvious large crack, a few feet right of the tree.

content.description: Start on opposing finger edges before moving up to a horizontal, followed by trickery to get stood up with the obvious undercling up and right.  From here, transition left onto quartz knobs to top out.
content.location: ~10 feet right of the tree that marks the start of Alien Route

content.description: Small, previously unnamed crag, with some bouldering history.
